Reviews.Title: “A problem of dampness”
Reviews.Author: Jerome D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hostel is really near from the center of Amsterdam and just in front of the zoo. The staff is nice and efficient. But there is a big problem of humidity in the hotel : it smells musty in the corridor and in the room, and consequently, the sheets are cold and damp.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Redman96 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again, 15 minute stroll into the centre and a very peaceful 2 nights sleep. The room was very small but we were out all day on both days of our stay so it was only to sleep and shower in. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly and the tram (number 9) stops outside, a great stay in Amsterdam and United won too, what more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Careless staff”
Reviews.Author: Pedro C
Reviews.Content: This hotel at a first glance, looked fine. The room had a 45 degrees tilted wall near the bed. I thought it was cool because when I layed in the bed I could see the sky through the window located on this wall. But then I found this to be a major issue as I came to hit my head on some wooden bars used to hold the structure. Bathrooms were ok, clean and heated. The staff was really bad, couldnt help me effectivelly on how to reach touristic locations and when I asked them for a glass of water they just gave me 2 empty glasses. As I asked for the water itself he carelessly said I would have to drink it from the sink. But then, its good if you just want a place to sleep as it is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Marko-Caco
Reviews.Content: What to say, after several years of living in Amsterdam, in private apartments, and student dorms, finally, I had a chance to sleep in a hotel. Once when in Amsterdam, the idea of sitting in your room is never a good idea, therefore, the idea is to find suitably located, and affordable basic hotel. This is Hotel Alfa Plantage. Expect very little, and you will get just a bit more. If you are over 1.85 m tall, pay some more EUR and get yourself a little bit more spacey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay again”
Reviews.Author: alisonjane39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights with 3 friends in twin bedded rooms. The rooms were fairly basic but very clean with good size bathrooms and our rooms were definately a decent size. Doesn't offer breakfast but we didn't find this a problem as there is a super cafe directly opposite. For us the location couldn't have been better. About 15/20 minute walk into the centre (10 euros by taxi) so close enough to get to easily but far enough out that we werent troubled by noise. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Kidids
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Alfa Plantage is the location. Within 2 blocks to any direction you choose to walk when you get out of it you will find the Artis Zoo, the Hortus, the best coffeeshop in town (Het Ballonnetje) and several cafes, bars and restaurants. Though it is a little bit far from the Centraal Station, there is a Tram stop (lines 9 and 4) literally in front of the building. The room we got (the very same #15 other people are complaining about) was pretty good: clean, quiet and with a very good bathroom. The only thing I didn't like was the wifi, because it didn't work all the time (altough sometimes it did).

Reviews.Title: “You have to leave the room to change your mind”
Reviews.Author: Discerning_Eye_USA
Reviews.Content: Be Prepared for a Miniature Room if you get #15. Have to say that first. My girlfriend and I stayed for two nights to the tune of 158 euros total through booking.com. I diligently went over the reviews on this site and left thinking it would be an average room at best. IT IS NOT WORTH IT. YOU CAN DO BETTER, JUST BE PREPARED TO HUNT. Now, on to the positives; the bathroom was clean. The reception people were helpful for the most part but uninformed on certain key points. There is a brewery down the road from the hotel that is built into a windmill. It is cool spot and we asked the reception guy, a young person with hipster glasses, "what time does it close?" He told us not till late, 10 or 11 p.m. Turns out it closed at 8 on that particular night. We never made it inside or had one of their tasty beverages. It left a bad taste, no pun intended. Another good point to mention is that the hotel is in a quiet neighborhood. And there is a real cool bar just next door on Plantage steet. There are locals inside, and tables outside and it seems like everyone has to smoke in order to occupy them. But the music has a cool vibe and the bartender speaks some English. My girlfriend and I got our beers and just sat back and soaked it all in. It was one of the more memorable moments of our time in Amsterdam. Now back to the doll's house they call a hotel...the room is small, and when I say "SMALL," I mean s-m-a-l-l. I am sorry, but I have to keep emphasizing this. I am six feet four and have never been in prison or arrested, but staying in this property gave the feeling of solitary confinement. I think backpackers who stay in hostels have more room to leisurely enjoy their private or communal surroundings. I have read the reviews from others, and I understand that people just like to complain because they are given a forum. But TWO people should not be staying in what they consider a "double room." There may be two small beds in the room, but this room is not meant for two people. Both people cannot move about the room. One person has to lie on the bed or go for a smoke break in order for the other person to move about. I won't use the term "freely" because of the cell like confines, but you get the gist. One thing to note, we stayed in room #15. There is no phone in this room. I am not sure if there are phones in any of the rooms. But you should know that you cannot receive a wake up call. Without an alarm clock we had to ask the reception person to come knock on our door as a kind of wake up call. He obliged but it is just a budget situation that left us scratching our heads. One good thing is that no one is getting in there that does not belong. You have to walk by the reception area to get inside to the rooms, and this is a kind of security check so that no freaks or hairies gains access. Only stay here if you are a firm believer and understand wholeheartedly the concept of "Europe Small.'

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Amsterdam Arena and the Dam”
Reviews.Author: Woodall42
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff Quiet but has a bar, kebab shop, chinese , cash point and tram stop all virtually on the doorstep. I thought it was very good room 41 is quirky but we had the best sleeps ever

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Rob19822891
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very good stay at the hotel Alfa Plantage. Free upgrade to superior room upon arrival was an unexpected bonus! Rooms are basic but clean tidy with updated ensuite bathrooms. all in all very good and quite large for Amsterdam - far bigger rooms than that of the eden lancaster just down the road. Location is everything and this hotel has an excellent one. Just far enough out of town to be relaxed but an easy and attractive 10minute stroll when you want to be in the thick of it. There are also very, very nice cafes / bars / japanese & italian restaurants & take aways within a 30 second walk. Highly recommended for a fun weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Nice”
Reviews.Author: Stuffy193
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It was a good location, not dead central but within easy walking distance of everything and right by a tram stop. Was a very quiet and pretty neighbourhood. The rooms were clean and basic, perfectly acceptable. Small but clean bathrooms, good water pressure in the showers. For what we paid, very good value. Very friendly and helpful people at reception. Free WiFi :D My only negative points are: 1) No breakfast option (although I knew this when I booked, it's definately not a good idea in a city where there aren't many cafes open in the morning for breakfast!) 2) Not very soundproof walls (although if you're walking around Amsterdam all day you'll sleep through most levels of noise) 3) Slightly strange smell in the hallway. Not in the rooms though, so wasn't that much of an issue. Maybe drain problems? But, as I say, the rooms smelt fine!

Reviews.Title: “We wiped our feet leaving.....”
Reviews.Author: Bobbylid
Reviews.Content: It was in a nice location, but for the price we paid, we could have had a 4 Star in the city. The bedding was dirty on arrival, tiles falling off the wall in the bathroom, the floor was filthy, kettle was left with all stale water in it. On the first night a lightbulb exploded in our room and glass went everywhere, the owner came and picked bits up off the floor but apart from that housekeeping didn't bother cleaning the glass from the sides and it wasn't vacuumed either. It was noisy of a night with the trams going outside. The location is good with a supermarket close by and nice bars, but the hotel itself could do with a massive clean and buy new bedding and towels. Wouldn't recommend it , it's 3* status is very complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have hoped for better!”
Reviews.Author: Kadi86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely!!!!!!! 100% reccommed!!!!!! The room and bathroon were spotlessly clean - looked like it had been recently decorated. The TV had lots of english channels - inc a movie channel. Our shower was really powerful and clean towels were provided daily. The hotel has a lift which was great. The staff were really friendly and welcoming and there was someone on the reception desk 24/7. The hotel location is ideal; far enough away from the town centre to get a peaceful nights sleep but close enough to walk into the town centre. Its a 15 minute walk to the centre but there's lots of shops/market stalls along the way so it's an enjoyable walk. The trams are really frequent - drop off and pick up right outside the hotel. It takes about 5 minutes by tram and cost 2.50 euros. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “would not go back there”
Reviews.Author: Neslicik
Reviews.Content: Alfa plantage hotel is in the heart of Amsterdam and right across from tram station. Number 14 and 9 are making quite frequent stops that take you to anywhere in Amsterdam. There is no breakfast but there is free wireless internet. No warning on how much parking costs in the city (about 40 Euros for 24 hours). We had booked two rooms but due to the ash clouds we had to cancel our trip a week before our arrival.I called to cancel and I was told that I cannot cancel one of the rooms and was going to be charged to the credit card on file. 2 hours after this conversation, I called again to say that our flight was going to take-off and that I would like to get the room I cancelled back... BUT it was no longer available and that I could only get another standard room for twice the cost. Since we could not cancel the other room, we had to say yes!! When we arrived in the middle of the night, the gentleman at the reception desk gave us our keys, and gave directions to an affordable parking lot. He was very helpful and also recommended a nice restaurant that would be open after midnight. We stayed at room 31: broken doorknob for the bathroom, no remote control for the TV, the faucet was not attached, nose touched the wall when using the toilet, door handle of the room 43 came off. If you are looking for a clean place to sleep in Amsterdam, I think there are better/cheaper options out there.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a quiet place”
Reviews.Author: mikatu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood away from the buzz of the center but next door to many attractions like the Artis zoo, Rembrandt house, hermitage, Portuguese synagogue and resistance museum. In just 15m walk you are in the center (as alternative you can take the tram 9 that stops right in front of the hotel). The rooms are very small and don't expect any room in the closet to store your cloths (the best is to leave everything in the bags) but this is normal in Amsterdam. All the rooms near the center are very small (the big ones are very expensive). You have a clean bathroom with shower (stall shower not just a hole in the floor like some rooms I saw on internet). And you have free wireless (with a good connection). The staffs are friendly and are always available to answer to your questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: birmingham_girl32
Reviews.Content: This was along from the hotel I'd been staying in for a couple of nights (Eden Lancaster), so opposite from the zoo, on the main 14 and 9 tramlines. I was initially very happy with my choice as the room is very clean, very good shower room (not good if you are large though - it's very tight on space), which still looks new, bed comfortable and my room (number 5 on the ground floor), looks out inwards to other buildings. No kettle, has air con and small tv which sat on top of the small wardrobe. unfortunately as soon as people started to come in during the night, the door kept slamming and i was woken up a few times. I think my room may have been next to the stair well but also as the landing is very small, and I mean very small, the noise just bounced round. Shame really as I would otherwise recommend highly. Maybe okay if on another floor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: manchecastor
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe and I stayed at this hotel based off of reviews from this web-site and had a fantastic experience. The hotel is in a great location. 10 minute walk to the center of everything but quiet at night for sleep. ATM right outside the door and Tram #9 from Central Station stops right in front of the hotel. The rooms were quiet, very clean and just the right size for what I needed. It was all I expected and a little more. I plan on returning to Amsterdam and will more than likely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good cheap clean hotel, no frills but pleasent”
Reviews.Author: jkiddscot
Reviews.Content: seasoned business traveller ......... POSITIVE good price, not bad value Genuine helpful staff quiet location nice area modern decor clean by Tram stop (9,14 : 2 stops from Waterlooplein, 4 from Rembrandtsplein) NEGATIVE A kettle in room but no coffee, tea, cup or spoon in room All in All, I will probably go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Fortwilliamchess
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Don't confuse this hotel with the Plantage Hotel which is across the road and around the corner. Room was small but as I was already aware of this it was no problem at all, and I am on the very large size myself. Just meant only one at a time in the bathroom! If you have stayed in NY budget hotels you'll manage here no problem. Ours was an attic room with low beams - ouch! A big plus compared to similar hotels in Amsterdam is that it has an elevator. Even though it is small its way better than 'mountain climbing' the stairs. I now know why many Amsterdam buildings have a pulley system on the roof, there is just no way to get anything much larger than a suitcase up those narrow steep stairs. Friendly helpful staff, the lady on duty during the day in particular. Showed us on a map where to go etc. When asked she suggested an Italian/Turkish restaurant around the corner - excellent meal. Always felt safe in this area even after midnight. If you have time visit the Zoo it's a few hundred yards away, it also has planetarium shows but when we were there only in Dutch - a pity. As has been said before trams to town, nos. 9 and 14 are yards away and trams from town stop almost at the door. Night bus, no. 357, can be caught at 5 minutes to the hour all night from stop in Damrak beside Dam Square, cost 3.50 euro. Anne Frank house easily accessed from tram no. 14 going citywards. Riksmuseum and Van Gogh museum accessed by taking tram nos. 9 or 14, going countrywards, for 2 stops and then swithching to tram no. 10 heading west. Amsterdam is great, I'm just grateful to have survived the bicycles, LOL. Almost got creamed about 5 times. Many, many bicycle lanes run between the footpath and the road/tram tracks and I found it very easy to cross the road/tram tracks and then forget to look out for bicycles. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: LEEDSLASSLeeds
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel which I would go back to. Rooms on top floor small but everything we needed was there. Good modern power shower. Nice and quiet but still near enough to walk into centre. Lovely cafe opposite where breakfast can be eaten and also bar nearby too for on the way home! Nice to be away from all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: nmcloug
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with my girlfriend and had a good experience. We got a good deal on the price of a double room and so it turned out to be cheap and cheerful. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. There was no breakfast included, but there are one or two nice bars/restaurants nearby. The hotel was very clean and rooms were cleaned every morning, including a change of towels etc. We slept in on occasion and the cleaners didn't bother us which was great- they just knocked on the door and gave us some clean towels. We were in a third floor room with a window on the back of the hotel, so there was very little street noise etc. and we got three nights of undisturbed sleep! On the slightly negative side, the hotel lift fitted only two, maybe three, people at a time. The room size wasn't bad, however the en suite was extremely tight with the shower, toilet and sink literally on top of each other. The hotel window has very little restrictions to prevent falling, so a young family might want to request a room on the first floor. The hotel is located in a nice area. It is a bit away from the centre of amsterdam (I'd say a 1/2 hour walk at least to Dam square), but there is a tram stop rite outside the hotel. Take any tram going to central station to get into the city centre (takes less than 10 mins). To get back, take tram number 14 or 9. The trams are cheap (1.60 euro for the whole day) and run until 12.30 . Taxis from the city centre wil cost around 8-10 euro. Watch out for the hidden taxes added onto the price quoted by the hotel. In amsterdam, there is a 4 or 5% city tax charge and another 4 or 5% bank charge if you pay by credit card. In all, I'd recommend the alfa hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: marcoPisa-
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for three days and, honestly, this is probably one of the best choice i could have ever made. Rooms were very clean and no noise could be heard in the three days that I stayed. The bed were we slept had a window that faced the sky...very romantic and original choice! Staff was incredibily friendly and helpful with us - I work in a hotel as a receptionist too and I know how hard it is! - and any indication that they gave us was genuine. The hotel is located in an area where trams ans buses pass even in the night time, and you can reach the Dam square or the red light district in only ten minutes. Only one drawback: rooms aren't that big. In any case, should I return to this lovely town I would defintely choose this hotel again. Marco from Pisa.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, competitive price”
Reviews.Author: Scopix
Reviews.Content: This is a very affordable hotel to stay at considering the usual high lodging costs at Amsterdam. It is located between Amsterdam's Botanical Gardens and its zoo. Since visitors can walk literally from anywhere to anywhere within the tourist district at Amsterdam, it does not matter that this hotel is not right in the middle of the night activities. In fact, that's a plus since it is quiet at night in the absence of rowdy crowds. This hotel has just opened its doors for business in April of 2006. Its price is very competitive. I paid an average of 100 Euros per day for a 2-person bedroom. Staff members are courteous and helpful. It has a 24-hour service desk. The room is clean and functional, albeit small according to American standards. The hotel is situated right outside the tram stop for lines 9 and 14. So, a first time Amsterdam visitor can definitely locate the hotel easily. It is also near a water-cab stop. It takes about 20mins for me to walk from this hotel to The Dam. I did not find this hotel at Expedia or Travelocity. I booked it through (--). I was informed by some fellow travellers when I stayed at the hotel that they were paying 85 euros per day by calling them directly to make the reservation.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alfa Plantage
HotelInfo.Address: Plantage Middenlaan 26, Amsterdam, The Netherlands
